instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
Hello I have this board but it does not receive power, I have tried another power supply but at no time does it turn on the LED1 if I have some voltages on the pins of the board that has the 12v supply connector. I do not have a schematic of this board and I have not been able to find it.

I wanted to ask if I can check any fuses and get lucky. 

thanks for all

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nVB1f4rH6pagjh2TaCkgIoFCSYJ6qcRw/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

Do you get 12V_S5 and 3V3_S5?
Q8450/70 are the usual suspects...

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message: I had same problem but i got it working, do u unscrew cpu ? or changed thermal ?

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power

Hello I have

PP12V_S5= 12.04v
PP3V3_S5= 0.0v I have measured at different points to check and none have tension

very very thanks for schematic

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message: I have not tested, as the LED1 does not turn on I thought it was a short circuit problem or a burned track. Did you change the thermal paste to the processor?

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at L7610/50.
If good, then post U7600 voltages; pins 17, 18, 4, 5, 12.

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
hello again

L7610= 0 it beeps like it's shorted
L7650= value 1089/1101

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
Do NOT quote an entire post visible few centimeters above.
Please, maintain the forum aesthetic.

Lift L7610 one side and see where the short remains.

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
sorry  I have had a lot of work and I have not been able to do this last test. The problem is now I was about to check this and recheck in diode mode to make sure which one was failing and now the two components give me a short circuit ... I don't understand anything ... it is possible that the other day I did not go through some voltage residual?

Perhaps it has spoiled being on the table? hehehehe

Do I still do the test you told me or do you want me to try something new? Thank you

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message: Allow 10-15s after power is removed, before measuring in diode mode, or ohm scale.

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power

ohm scale value 0.00
diode mode beep shorted

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power

Hello I tried again (after a few days without electrical current) and in diode mode both components L7610 and L7650 short (beep).

If possible, continue to help me. Thank you very much

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
Lift one side the coils and see where the shorts remain; also post exact ohm values.
You didn't have short at L7650 before, what happened???

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
Ok I do this test with L7650 (at the moment I do not have a soldering iron and it is impossible for me) I will comment on the results.

Last time maybe in the rush I was not touching the component correctly to measure a short and from the beginning both components were short.

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
hi again, I change L7650 and this is fix don't have short. But L7610 I have a short with Pin1 3V3_S5

i have short in C7670 C7671 C7674 C7676 (value 0 mode diode beep)

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
Change the coil???
Impossible to have short to ground because of a coil into a buck-converter; the coil does NOT connect with ground.

I said to lift ONE pin of a coil and check which side the short to ground remains.

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
Sorry for my English that there was no presence of continuity in the coil.

I have lifted L7610 and I have the short to ground on Pin 1, I have checked the capacitors and at those points of the track I still have the short so the problem must come from a previous component

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
You can use voltage injection method.
What is the exact ohm value of the short to ground?

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message: You can NOT measure ohm scale, or diode mode on a powered board; is a big NONSENSE!!!

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
You have not understood me well, excuse me. I know I can make a short film this way.

I only commented on having a voltage of 3v in the power connector so that I knew that the source was connected and that everything was correct. I didn't want you to think it had a value of 0 ohms because of a bad power supply connection or a problem with this part. Sorry.

threads.title: 820-00291 iMac 27" 5k 2015 no power
threads.message:
"You can use voltage injection method."

Start with 1V and go up if needed, no more than 4V.
Set first the amp limit of lab PSU at max.
